caption: Cheese slice was very bad

This pizza is TRULY amazing. I am very picky but hands down this is THE BEST PIZZA IN BROOKLYN!!!!! And the people that own/ run the store are ABSOLUTELY AMAZING like literally they are so sweet awesome and kind. They forever have my business!!
Vegan pizza is really good. I really like the "Cheese" they use.
Good value
great Grandma slice!
One of my favorite spots for pizza! Wished they open earlier but a great spot for vegetarian/vegan pizza. Have yet to go wrong.
Amazing vegan option , they have but free options, lovelyyyyyyy
Visited Norbert's yesterday evening and thoroughly enjoyed their slices.  Would recommend stopping by!  Definitely the best pizza option off of the Myrtle JMZ stop.

After Archie’s closed my bf and I started ordering from Norbert’s. We love their classic cheese pie. I recommend picking up rather than getting delivered if you live nearby. Our pizza usually arrives cold (which obviously isn’t there fault) and the last time our driver via Seamless must have dropped our pizza and delivered it anyway... we called and they offered to give us another pizza! The gentleman on the phone was polite and professional and we went and picked it up. We will continue to order from them and always pick up our pizza from now on! Cute place too! Sad we haven’t been in person sooner.
Awesome vegan slices & chill vibes staff. Personally love the vegan hawaiian pie.
Small pizza shop with a Big personality of taste. Excellent slices!!!! Def try the Grandma of you aren't shy from garlic. Seats outside
5 stars because the vegan pepperoni pizza is like stealing the impossible objects from the machine elves.
Good Music 😏
Really great pizza and solid vegan options (not vegan but I tried and wasn’t disappointed). Very friendly staff and super clean spot. Norberts has become my go-to post subway snack. Love them!
Great pizza and great service! Absolutely charming attitude from the staff during these unprecedented times!!! Norberts forever!!!!

Their pizza is great, but just now the woman who answered the phone to take my order was ABSOLUTELY RUDE!!! SORRY NORBERT NO BUSINESS FOR YOU UNTIL YOU CHECK HER ATTITUDE !!!!!!! TOTALLY DISAPPOINTED 😔

Oh my goodness, just had my first slice of pizza yesterday, it was DELICIOUS!!👏🏽👏🏽👍🏽👍🏽❤️ Going back today to try the pepperoni version. Some of the best pizza I’ve tasted in a while. PLEASE visit them whenever you’re in or near the area?

the pizza is awesome and the atmosphere is really cool and always changing. I just don't understand their hours... the place will randomly be closed on a Tuesday or Thursday or even for a few days at a time. would be 5 stars if there was just some consistency in the hours. Otherwise i love the place.

Phenomenal vegan pizza. You’re better off eating in though because orders on Grubhub have a higher-than usual likelihood of being canceled and/or late.  Update: New vegan pizza recipe is a definite downgrade. The vegan garlic knots, however, are still delicious.

I am a new customer and wanted to share my experience after my go to pizza place was shut down. now I look for  a clean place to eat as well as quality. Pizza is really good, classic Brooklyn pizza and most important for me it is consistent which is hard to find
Super tasty, unique slices that are relatively inexpensive

Update: They cleaned the place up. Stepped up their pizza. But the prices are higher too.  The vegan pizza is really good. But I would definitely understand if it's not for everyone.  The regular pizza is okay. It's school pizza tier, not up to real Brooklyn pizza standards. It's serviceable. I sometimes still get it alongside a vegan slice. But yeah come here for the vegan pizza not the cheese.

I had avoided this place after having some really terrible vegan pizza here. I reluctantly revisited again because it was the only thing open and close by before having a show. To my surprise, they have improved their vegan pizza tremendously because of a new owner and it was some of the best vegan pizza I’ve ever had. Fresh ingredients and super delicious!
The vegan pizza tastes amazing.  The garlic knots are delicious.
Very nice and cool cashier here. Delicious pizza.
Good pizza decent price. The service is great. Another good nyc pizza experience.
Twice I’ve ordered from Norbert’s and twice they haven’t had the items I ordered. I don’t understand that
Great old fashioned pizza & crispy crust

You know what...I pre-judged Norbert's. They don't have that classic NYC pizzeria vibe and judging from the small re-heater oven plus the fact that one guy was working here all alone, I thought it would be awful. I did wait for a bit longer than I'm used to, but the pizza was actually pretty good! I would go back.
Great pizza! delicious, thick crunchy crust 😋
Sweet spot for a single vegan slice. Good music too.
Vegan pizza is the best option for the neighborhood, could be improved but the effort is well appreciated.
A little grimy but delicious as hell. Awesome veg pizza at good prices.
I'm done with them. The quality of the pizza has gotten worse n worse..... I'm done.
Extremely disappointed!!! Bought two vegan slices they were terrible!! I used to love eating here smh

A great vegan pizza restaurant. Cute original Brooklyn pizza decore inside houses a few small to seater booths. Mix in a cool staff and you got the makings of a great alternative place to eat. The pizza is incredible good as well.

Ordered a vegan pie online. Went to pick it up about 40 minutes later. When arrived at the shop I was informed that “their oven has been down all day” (it doesn’t even make sense, seriously what the heck) and they can’t make a pie now because they gotta start closing soon. Aside from the lame excuse they had 40 minutes to call to let me know and save me the trip but they didn’t. Alright. The dude working said the best he can do is to heat up the last two vegan slices for me that HIS WORDS: been sitting on the shelf pretty much all day. I never should’ve agreed because the slices did taste like they indeed been at least a day old (I swear, the overnight leftover pizza tastes more fresh) and I think he lied about hitting them up because after a 7 minute car ride back home it was absolutely cold. He didn’t even offer neither a discount for the old stale slices nor an apology for not making the pre-ordered pie. What a joke of a place.
Their Grandma's pizza is out of this world! Also serve vegan options, if you so desire.
REFUSED TO HEAT UP PIZZA ... JERKS TO CUSTOMERS --- BAD ATMOSPHERE

Great little slice joint with lots of vegan options! They had a few vegan sandwiches for $7 each (like BBQ chik'n, sausage and peppers) as well as one vegan slice out on display. The crust is amazing, a perfect NY style slice, but I wish they'd upgrade their cheese from Daiya to something like Violife.  One thing to note is that the hours don't seem to be right on Google maps. They were closed when we tried to go on a Sunday at 4 pm and didn't open until like 5 or 6 pm.
The pizza is so yummy. The spinach tomato is my fave. They also have vegan pizza. Joanna is awesome. Drop some $$ in the tip jar before you go!
Excellent pizza, guys behind the counter were very personable. And they had King of the Hill on the tv!

(Translated by Google) Definitely a great place! There is a variety in the portions and they are super good, great size and incredible price. If you are in the area, do not hesitate to stop.  (Original) Definitivamente un local genial ¡¡ Hay variedad en las porciones y están super buenas, gran tamaño y precio increíble. Si estáis por la zona,  No dudéis en parar.
Delicious pizza! The vegan and grandma slice are incredible!
Really good pizza...The white slice is on point.
Amazing hole in the wall, has great guilt-free options and a really kind owner. Really low prices and a casual environment.

Does anyone know when this place is actually open? The website, yelp page, and google maps all say that it should be open at 2:30 on a Saturday, yet this is the FIFTH time we’ve tried going here that it is closed without explanation. And how is anyone getting pizza delivered to them when they never answer the phone? Such a mystery.
Great Pizza. Opens a bit late some days but the food is fantastic. Everything is veggie and many vegan options.

Sandwiches are better than the pizza which is absurd.  Pizza itself isn’t bad but they insist on throwing literal gallons of olives on each individual slice which spoils it for anyone who doesn’t worship the olive  Still eat there from time to time tho bc I have their name tattooed on my neck
Great pizza

I LOVE the vodka pizza slice! So yummy! The option of vegan sandwiches and pizza slices is also cool. They definitely take a little bit longer than normal, but the food is really tasty. The staff is super chill and nice. I’m not a huge fan of their sandwiches as they can be lacking in substance meaning there isn’t much to them but a little bit of fake meat, some veggies, and sauce, but they are generally tasty.
Food arrived 2 hours late and was not even close to what I ordered. Staff was completely incompetent and argumentative. Refused to resend food and did not even apologize. Horrible service.
Super cool pizza spot with many veggie/vegan options
It's a fine place if you don't have anywhere else to go, but there's much better pizza in the area.

Small space but FOH are very friendly and engaging. I felt a lot of good vibes from this place. Vegan Pizza is good! I wasn't a fan of  their non pizza items, specifically their vegan "wings" they weren't wings, they resembled more of a drumstick and they were very greasy. I actually vomited after eating one and gave the rest away.

A bunch of yuppies who are too busy to worry about your pizza, instead they're worried about there outfits and what tracks are playing through the speakers(they play music so loud they get the orders wrong 90% of the time). Don't go here if you're hungry because the staff doesn't give af. If I could give zero stars I would actually give it to this place

Really tasty, affordable pizza! Great sandwiches! Everything here is vegetarian or vegan so for those who don’t eat meat there is nothing to worry about. Staff is very friendly and helpful. There’s no bathroom unfortunately. There are a couple of tables and seats and cool music. If you order for delivery put your order in early because it gets very busy!
The Grandma slice is to die for. The crust is deliciouso
Ordered custom pizza. It was good
It's cheap
Good inexpensive pizza
All veggie and vegan options. Super tasty pizza and sandwiches. I haven't had a chance to try their pasta yet but it's on my list.
pizza as great as their politics 🍕 all vegetarian slices +  the vegan slice is incred + amazing shirts + amazing staff + support your local pizza parlor y'all

great food, although somewhat inconsistent. i suggest going there without expectations of what to order cuz something you want will probably be out of stock. but what is there is generally quite good and overall i definitely do recommend the place.
Small place with vegan pizza, which was tasty and affordable! Alternative crowd and style, would go there again.
Decent pizza & the only slice shop in the neighborhood. Service can be slow and the pizzas are all vegetarian or vegan.

First time going  the girl that work the counter touch my pizza with her nails when putting it inside the bag... she also had a attitude. I just looked at her and took my pizza because my bus was coming. I didn't even eat the pizza, i put it in the garbage outside. The pizza was also cold...Never again!!!
They're never open!!!!!! Seriously just just open whenever they feel like it.....plus staff is super rude. They act like they're doing you a favor ....
Got one cheese and one pep slice, and they were both alright. Alright sauce, alright cheese, and alright crust. An alright spot.
Great pizzas and friendly staff. Definitely recommend. Everything here is also vegetarian/vegan
Good fast pizza.
Great place great people and the pizza is fabulous. Best keep secret in Bushwick.
Even though I normally prefer meat on my pizza and this is a vegetarian place, the grandma slice is amazing!
The pizza is probably the best in the area.

This place is convenient and tasty, I wouldnt say its the best pizza in brooklyn, but alas pizza is pizza and this is pretty good. I think as a new yorker you start to split hairs when it comes to pizza and your preferences. I think the only thing I would improve is the crust, to me it needs a little more texture, other than that, delicious salty cheese and sweet sauce to balance it out.
The pizza was pretty good. Got harassed by a crazy Christian lady out side.
Great place for a slice on the way home. The pizza is delicious and the staff is very nice. Good prices too.
I'm here visiting from LA and none of us know how to find decent food in New York, and then we went to Norbert's and the staff was so nice and friendly and the pizza is absolutely amazing
Go for the really good pizza, not the "customer service" ;)
Pizza was great,  slices were 2,5-3$, even the  vegan slices were awesome. Staff seemed to be disinterested, could have been more fliendly. Small place with 2 small tables
Used to be a fan of this place.  Till I made an order and it didn't show up for three hours.  Phone lines were busy and never got an answer.  When it showed up Pizza was old and cold.  Never again.

Do. Not. Order. Pizza arrived wildly late (and stone cold) and when we called  to check on it during our extended wait, an belligerent and insolent phone person called my boyfriend a name and insulted us. We had to call Grubhub to settle the situation and they received the same treatment we did. Don't give your money to this business.

Very unpleased, a hour and 15 mins wait time. Then when my food did arrive. The pizza was cold and the salad I order came without salad dressing,  And to TOP IT OFF, THE DELIVERY DRIVER BEGGED FOR EXTRA TIP!!.
Best pizza in Brooklyn! Amazing food and even better service.
Love this mtf PLACE ! Tha dopest.

They got a good vegan slice, not too much cheese and lots of vegetables. They had a greasy vegan buffalo chicken and cheese rolled up thing that was pretty good. Sound track of Donna Summers ensured this good review.

If I could give minus five I would, I ordered pizza and what I got was GARBAGE! I order from this place all the time and it usually good but today was just UNREAL, first of all, when I called the person was really rude and was talking to me as if he is doing me a favor or as if he was stoned out of his f**ing mind, I had to repeat myself 5 time, then I got me pizza the delivery guy was super nice and even though got the address wrong at first( because obvi the person who took the order messed it up) I didn't care about that, the pizza I got WAS COLD, BURNT AND THE TOPPINGS WERE WRONG, it looked like something pulled out of the garbage. I called to complain and the guy I talked to said there is nothing he is going to do about it, he can only give us free topping next time (for real?) so I said I'm never going to order again and he will write him the worst review and his response was "Go ahead, honey.." GROSS!!
Gross. Vegan Pizza? Who let that happen. Music was also way too loud. A brooklyn spot putting carrots on Pizza? Blasphemy. If you're looking for real Pizza place run far far away.

1 hour for delivery. I had to call them and ask about my order, the person on the phone was very nice. Chicken in their $6 sandwiches tasted like soy (edit: because apparently they were veggie chicken sandwiches, my bad). And you can buy a better, bigger and more delicious sandwich at some corner store for the same price. And they forgot my garlic knots.. I'm not going to order anything from this place again (edit: I might give this place another chance, the owners are pretty cool, I think). EDIT. Thanks for your response. Though you did forget my garlic knots :D
Their pizza isn't good and they are overpriced. It's not your usual NY pizza. The shop is cute.
Great slices for a late nite snack. Boxed nicely and NOT greasy
I enjoy their pizza, but after repeated rude experiences at both locations, I will probably not order from or stop in a Norbert's again.
Great pizza , prompt service
It's a nice small business and I was served pretty quickly. They have vegan options as well
I love their Grandmas pizza it's full of flavor. Delicious plum tomatoes and garlic. Prior to that I had to enjoy pizza by my job

Never open. They say they open at 11 but I just walked past (12:30) nothing. Would love a slice (it's dope!) but they aren't open... also, the delivery pizza is not even made on premises and took forever last time I ordered. Boo! I want to like this place!!!

Ordered two pizzas for a lil pizza party on a Wednesday night. Sat around on our tails and all of a sudden we were wasted on the two beers each we'd had cause it'd been two hours! Eventually after an hourlong hyperactive  fit of calling the busy phone line over and over and over again, one cold pizza showed up, a clever combo of the two weordered. Truly creative and inspiring and conceptual. They were apologetic and comped the order, which I appreciated. The delivery guy was but an angel on two rusty wheels rarely greased. Honestly  in the world we live in how could  you be mad after getting a delicious pizza for free after two hours of getting stoned and irritably building up an appetite. The garlic knots. The garlic knots are knot great. Jk they're great. Must be a lot of pressure having a pizza joint in NYC. Oh boy it was the best slightly cold pizza I've ever had.  #friendly #goodcoldfreepizza

Classic Brooklyn pizza taste that I remember as a kid. The place seems kinda rocker slash grunge slash underground hip hop. I wouldn't necessarily take the kids there with the scary cat in the window and adult music playing but for the adult crowd it's a cool spot to chill at.  The place is small tho so don't plan on eating there but there are a couples of bench seats outside.  Oh and don't expect super professional experience (sometimes they cool, other times not so much), it's just a local shop. Go get your pizza and get out. Wouldn't try using Grub Hub to order anything delivered.

Ordered the simplest order possible (large cheese pizza), called to check the order after an hour to which they said the delivery guy had *just* left, only to call 45 MORE minutes later to find out they never put in my order therefore there is no pizza and now they're closing.  Update:  Called again to redeem my free pizza from the previous mishap, to which the guy said my address could not be found from the free pies list. When asked to speak with someone else, he simply laughed then said "no, bye" and hung up.  Oh.

I have been ordering from here for a year and loved it but the past 2 rings have been completely unacceptable. I waited an hour and 40 minutes for delivery. The last 40 minutes I called and called again with no answer and busy tones. Finally they answered after 3 minutes of ringing and they said their phone's were down. That's funny... I didn't realize it of commission phones could get busy signals. Never patronizing again.  Edit: broke down and decided to give them a second chance. It's been an hour and a half since ordering on grub hub. Called them and asked what's the status and it hasn't even gone out for delivering. They said they are really "backed up". Really pro crew over there...
Love the vegan slice!

New review  They are completely incompetent with their sourcing. I ordered pasta once but they never again had it in stock (how does an Italian restaurant not have pasta?) Then they ran out of mushrooms for someone's pizza (how do you run out of one of the most common vegetables?) And when I came back and decided on a mozzarella sandwich, they were out of fresh mozzarella (which is a staple of Italian food). Very disappointing. Apparently all they can manage to do is cheese pizza.  —  Old review  Great local spot! Affordable and homey. They advocate against gentrification and for other causes with the fliers in their window.  Everything here is vegetarian, which is entirely welcome, especially in a neighborhood that's not hipster. Most of their sandwiches are vegan, too.  I got their pasta for $6 (cheaper than even some other places on Broadway, such as Broadway Pizza). It was good. Decently large and cheesy and carby without being too saucy.  But another time I came in and they were out of pasta. How do you run out of pasta when you're an Italian restaurant? They were out of it for three days and had an attitude about it, too.  Love their values and their food. They need to get their inventory in order.
Grandma slice, white slice, at least once a week post a hang out session at Silent Barn.
Best pizza joint in the neighborhood, especially if your aren't a fan of the grease which accompanies traditional NYC pizza.
Plain slices are my favorite, but all others (vodka, grandma, vegan) are just as good
Cool little hipster pizza joint. Great, flavorful NY-style pizza. Only $2 for a plain slice!
Poor customer service, lukewarm slices and overpriced. Time and time again it has disappointed.
Sweet hole in the wall joint. Solid quality
(Translated by Google) The best pizza in Brooklyn !!!!  (Original) La pizza più buona di Brooklyn !!!!

i moved from new haven (if you know new haven you know why this is important) and found this to be my nearest pizza joint, and must say I couldn't have found a better option in bushwick. not a vegan but the sheer tastiness and satisfaction of 2 grandma slices and a soda is hard to beat. this place was my go to afterwork. plus rad anarcho/politacalprisoner/local events lit and fliers.
Decent pizza, good music
One of the best slices I've found in all of NY. I should dock them a star for not having meat but the cheese slice is delicious and cheap and I want them to do good business!
Best pizza I've ever tasted!!
I live a few blocks away and come here often they are always friendly, fast and delicious! I recommend the grandma slice
love their pizza. im not a vegan at all and I love it. so does my kiddies.
Vegan pizza with lots of variety for styles of pizza base.
A very tasty cheese slice, but they rarely have good specialty option.
